action.action-desc: Mr. Gallagher (for himself, Mr. Krishnamoorthi, Mr. Roy, Mr. Raskin, Mr. Wittman, Ms. Sherrill, Mr. Banks, Ms. Spanberger, Mr. Johnson of South Dakota, Mr. Moulton, and Ms. Brown) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend the Foreign Agents Registration Act of 1938, as amended to clarify the obligation of individuals who formerly served as agents of foreign principals to register retroactively as foreign agents under the Act with respect to activities carried out previously on behalf of such foreign principals, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Retroactive Foreign Agents Registration Act.

section.header: Clarifying obligation to register retroactively as agents of foreign principals

subsection.text: The third sentence of section 2(a) of the Foreign Agents Registration Act of 1938, as amended (22 U.S.C. 612(a)) is amended by striking for the period and inserting covering the period.

The amendment made by subsection (a) shall apply with respect to any individual who serves as the agent of a foreign principal under the Foreign Agents Registration Act of 1938, as amended, at any time before, on, or after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Permitting order requiring compliance to apply retroactively

subsection.text: Section 8(f) of the Foreign Agents Registration Act of 1938, as amended (22 U.S.C. 618(f)) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: by inserting after the first sentence the following: The Attorney General may make application for an order requiring a person to comply with any appropriate provision of this Act or any regulation thereunder while the person acts as an agent of a foreign principal or at any time thereafter.; and

by striking the period at the end and inserting the following: , including an order requiring a person to comply with section 2 with respect to any period during which the person acts as the agent of a foreign principal notwithstanding that the person does not act as the agent of a foreign principal at the time the court issues the order..
